intro: Teucrium melillense var. embergeri, commonly known as the Emberger's germander, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its aromatic, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and traditional herbal uses.
